ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Multiple Sclerosis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of relapsing-remitting neurological symptoms (paresthesia, optic neuritis, Lhermitte's sign) and retrocochlear findings on ABR (interwave delays, poor MLS morphology) consistent with demyelinating disease.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Baseline assessment of peripheral hearing sensitivity.
Evaluation of neural integrity in the auditory brainstem.
High-rate stimulation to stress the auditory neural pathway and reveal subtle retrocochlear deficits.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrated normal peripheral hearing sensitivity and excellent speech recognition. However, electrophysiological testing revealed retrocochlear pathology on the right side. Conventional ABR showed abnormal interwave latencies on the right, and the high-rate MLS ABR revealed a significantly degraded response on the right, confirming functional auditory compromise consistent with Multiple Sclerosis.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Speech recognition was excellent for both ears.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Left ear: Normal waveform morphology and indices (Wave I: 1.9 ms, III: 4.0 ms, V: 6.2 ms). Right ear: Normal to slightly extended absolute latencies; abnormal I-III and I-V interwave latency differences.

tests.name: Maximum Length Sequence (MLS) ABR
tests.result_summary: Left ear: Normal response (Wave V: 7.4 ms). Right ear: Extremely shallow response with questionable presence of waves.

proposed_items: Monitor auditory function as part of neurological care
counseling_actions: Explain that peripheral hearing is normal
Discuss ABR results indicating delayed nerve transmission on the right side
Correlate auditory findings with the diagnosis of Multiple Sclerosis
Advise that difficulty hearing in noise may occur despite normal thresholds

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is already under care for Multiple Sclerosis; auditory findings confirm retrocochlear involvement and should be communicated to the managing neurologist.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor for progression of auditory neural deficits.

expected_outcome: Conventional ABR showed mildly abnormal findings for the right ear (abnormal I-III and I-V interwave latency differences).
MLS ABR findings were highly abnormal for the right ear, showing an extremely shallow response with questionable presence of waves.
The results indicate functional central auditory compromise on the right side, consistent with Multiple Sclerosis, despite the MRI not explicitly showing brainstem involvement.
